text: Kitagawa Utamaro (; – 31 October 1806), also called Utamaro, was a Japanese artist. He was a master of the ukiyo-e style of woodblock prints and painting.Nussbaum, Louis Frédéric et al. (2005). "Utamaro" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 1018. ==Career== Utamaro is known for his studies of women (bijinga). He also made nature studies. His work was popular in Europe. He influenced artists in Europe who were called Impressionists. ==Gallery== File:Kitagawa Utamaro I, published by Moriya Jihei - Couple with a Standing Screen - Google Art Project.jpg|Two women inspecting silk File:Flickr - …trialsanderrors - Utamaro, Young lady blowing on a poppin, 1790.jpg|Young lady blowing on a poppin, 1790 File:Maple Leaves Koyo and Shamisen by Kitagawa Utamaro c1803.png|Geisha playing the shamisen, 1803 File:Brooklyn Museum - Still Life Flowers - Kitagawa Utamaro.jpg|Still life flowers, c. 1802-1806 ==References== == Other websites == * Kitagawa Utamaro Online * Utamaro * (from "Collection of Insects in Pictures") * Kitagawa Utamaro at Hill-Stead Museum, Farmington, Connecticut Category:1753 births Category:1806 deaths Category:Japanese printmakers
title: Kitagawa Utamaro
